definition: to put sb in powerful position/to empower
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: There's very little point in protesting.
sentences.chinese: 反对也无济于事，反对也没有多大用。

sentences.english: The check out assistant at my usual supermarket is always rude and unhelpful.
sentences.chinese: 我经常去的超市的收银员总是很粗鲁而且没多大用处。

sentences.english: However, his are not always is used.
sentences.chinese: 然而，东方朔却始终不见被大用。

sentences.english: It's up to you. If you think it isn't of much use, you may throw them out.
sentences.chinese: 你决定吧，如果觉得没多大用，就扔了吧。

sentences.english: U of T will then apply the information to multiple scholarship applications.
sentences.chinese: 之后，多大用这些信息来处理多种奖学金的申请。

sentences.english: It's nice, but not particularly helpful.
How useful is Said's concept of Orientalism to historical research on Asia or Africa?
sentences.chinese: 萨义德的东方主义概念对于亚非历史研究有多大用处？

sentences.english: That night, Ch'ang climbed over the wall, and down the ladder.
sentences.chinese: 至夜，大用登垣，墙下果有花梯在。

sentences.english: At the work, Dayong began to realize that his wife and her sister were peony flower goddesses .
sentences.chinese: 大用这才知道自己的妻子和弟妹都是牡丹花神变的。

definition: usefulness/CL:個|个[ge4]
how can one endure?/to be able to endure
useless/worthless
to lean on/to rely on
talented field commander (military)
to count on/to rely on
worrisome
to put in an important position
able/capable/competent/efficient
and so on/so and so/many and confused
therefore
moreover/besides
to give no cause for anxiety/nothing to worry about
ample scope for abilities/favorable position for the use of one's skills (idiom)
to cast pearls before swine (idiom)/not to get proper recognition for one's talents
using a talented person in an insignificant position (idiom)/a sledgehammer to crack a nut
